-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command '$ifw_api_command$'

-SqlUsername.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLHealth_String_SqlUsername$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLHealth_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-SqlDatabase.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLHealth_String_SqlDatabase$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-SqlHost.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLHealth_String_SqlHost$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-Instance.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLHealth_String_Instance$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-SqlUsername.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLBackupStatus_String_SqlUsername$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLBackupStatus_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-SqlHost.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLBackupStatus_String_SqlHost$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-SqlUsername.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLResource_String_SqlUsername$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLResource_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-SqlHost.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLResource_String_SqlHost$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-SqlDatabase.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLResource_String_SqlDatabase$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-SqlUsername.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLPerfCounter_String_SqlUsername$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLPerfCounter_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-SqlDatabase.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLPerfCounter_String_SqlDatabase$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-SqlHost.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckMSSQLPerfCounter_String_SqlHost$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

11.description: Warning threshold for the last log backup age, which returns the elapsed time since a database was last backupped
11.caption: LastBackupAgeWarning

7.description: Warning threshold for the average backupsize which represent an average backupsize of all backups
7.caption: AvgBackupSizeWarning

62.description:
Allows this plugin to use the credentials of the current PowerShell session inherited by
the user the PowerShell is running with. If this is set and the user the PowerShell is
running with can access to the MSSQL database you will not require to provide username
and password
62.caption: IntegratedSecurity

64.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])e
64.caption: Verbosity

42.description: The username for connecting to the MSSQL database
42.caption: SqlUsername

45.description: The port of the MSSQL server/instance to connect to with the provided credentials
45.caption: SqlPort

20.description: The IP address or FQDN to the MSSQL server to connect to
20.caption: SqlHost

56.description:
Warning threshold for the Buffer cache hit ratio which Indicates the percentage of pages found in the buffer cache without having to read from disk.
The ratio is the total number of cache hits divided by the total number of cache lookups over the last few thousand page accesses. After a long period
of time, the ratio moves very little. Because reading from the cache is much less expensive than reading from disk, you want this ratio to be high.
Generally, you can increase the buffer cache hit ratio by increasing the amount of memory available to SQL Server or by using the buffer pool extension
feature.
56.caption: BufferCacheHitRatioWarning

12.description: Critical threshold for the last backup age, which returns the elapsed time since a database was last backupped
12.caption: LastBackupAgeCritical

61.description: The name of a specific database to connect to. Leave empty to connect "globally"
61.caption: SqlDatabase

17.description:
Specifies the database or databases which will be checked. Leave empty to fetch metrics from
all databases on the given system
17.caption: IncludeDatabase

51.description: Critical threshold for the page life expectancy which indicates the number of seconds a page will stay in the buffer pool without references.
51.caption: PageLifeExpectancyCritical

44.description: The IP address or FQDN to the MSSQL server to connect to
44.caption: SqlHost

41.description:
List of Performance Counters specified by their full path (example '\SQLServer:Buffer Manager\Buffer cache hit ratio')
to fetch information for
41.caption: PerformanceCounter

13.description: Warning threshold for the execution time, which returns the elapsed time how long the backup process took
13.caption: ExecutionTimeWarning

27.description: The warning threshold for the connection time to the MSSQL database as time interval (ms, s, h, m)
27.caption: Warning

30.description: The username for connecting to the MSSQL database
30.caption: SqlUsername

53.description: Critical threshold for the Average Latch Wait Time (ms) for latch requests that had to wait.
53.caption: AverageLatchWaitTimeCritical

18.description: The username for connecting to the MSSQL database
18.caption: SqlUsername

36.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
36.caption: NoPerfData

29.description:
The name of the database instance to check the service state for. Can either the MSSQL$DB1 or simply DB1
for example
29.caption: Instance

23.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
23.caption: NoPerfData

19.description: The password for connecting to the MSSQL database as secure string
19.caption: SqlPassword

38.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
38.caption: ThresholdInterval

47.description:
Allows this plugin to use the credentials of the current PowerShell session inherited by
the user the PowerShell is running with. If this is set and the user the PowerShell is
running with can access to the MSSQL database you will not require to provide username
and password
47.caption: IntegratedSecurity

49.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])

15.description:

24.description:
Specifies the number of days to read the backup history from MSSQL. Over time, the history table can get quite
large and if there is no maintenance task in place to shrink it, this script could time out. By default the entire
history is evaluated.
24.caption: IncludeDays
